title: NEW YORK
content:
Here are some nice fonts waiting to be solved!!

**(1)**  
NEW YORK

**(2)**  
EARLY ADVENTURES  
IN THE BIG CITY

**(3)**  
{

**(4)**  
New York (swashed, at the bottom)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NewYork_4999.png)
author: rosmedia

comments.content: EARLY ADVENTURES IN THE BIG CITY -Neutraface [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063752/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface")

(2) "EARLY ADVENTURES"(etc) is Neutra Display: [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829063752/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface")

"New York" at the bottom? I'm pretty sure that's a custom typeface made for the logo.
To my untrained eyes My First and NEW YORK look like a modified Caslon (337?) Italic with swashes

@ Alaskan

what logo?

@ Stavros & Alaskan  
Thanx for Memphis + Neutraface

@ Atwe  
and yes it loox a little like Caslon. Do you think the { } are also Caslon?
"My First" is Adobe Caslon Pro, with the OpenType swash caps activated.

aha.. okay now I get it..  
New York Magazine has a logo of course.
